title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
00:08 <flyingpot> has quit  
00:24 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
03:06 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
03:11 <flyingpot> has quit  
04:19 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
04:21 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki

05:12 <flyingpot> has quit  
05:13 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has joined #xwiki  
05:17 <xwikiorg\_guest\_5> has quit  
05:21 <OSIMasson1> has quit  
06:01 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
07:09 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
07:13 <flyingpot> has quit  
07:25 <vmassol> bhu: 404 means you're using the wrong url  
07:25 <vmassol> and hte image is not on github  
07:25 <vmassol> it's on dockerhub  
07:26 <vmassol> see https://hub.docker.com/\_/xwiki/  
08:43 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
09:07 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <zwindler> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <zwindler> vmassol : sorry I left without telling yesterday  
09:32 <zwindler> I was in a hurry  
09:32 <vmassol> zwindler: ah glad you're back :)  
09:32 <zwindler> so, I was telling you yesterday  
09:32 <zwindler> on your image, I changed 2 things  
09:33 <zwindler> postgresql 9.5 instead of 9.6  
09:33 <zwindler> and I changed the hibernate file  
09:33 <zwindler> and when I docker-compose up  
09:33 <zwindler> I get a running instance  
09:33 <vmassol> yes I also get a running instance but that's not the problem  
09:33 <zwindler> I get as far as distribution wizard  
09:33 <vmassol> the problem are the errors in the logs  
09:34 <vmassol> what did you change in hiberbate.cfg.xml?  
09:34 <zwindler> ok because I didn't got that far yesterday  
09:34 <zwindler> (distribution wizard I mean)  
09:35 <zwindler> so I thought it was your issue  
09:35 <vmassol> what I'd like to know are 2 things:  
09:35 <vmassol> 1) what you changed in hibenrate.cfg.xml  
09:35 <vmassol> 2) when you use your own xwiki image can you check the xwiki logs to see if you have the problem too?  
09:36 <vmassol> (your own image = the zwindler one on dockerhub)  
09:36 <zwindler> Just to be sure, what problem are you talking about  
09:36 <vmassol> (because I couldn't get it to work on my side)  
09:36 <vmassol> I'm talking about this in the logs:  
09:37 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/4c19e060934c71e12794fbe495e58fa6#file-gistfile1-txt-L62  
09:37 <vmassol> lines 62-65  
09:37 <zwindler> ok  
09:37 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <vmassol> (I couldn't get your image to work = for some reason when I open my browser to http://localhost:8080 tomcat didn't respond)  
09:38 <zwindler> let's put aside my own image I might have tampered with it  
09:39 <zwindler> Yesterday I was doing multiple things at once, so I misinterpreted what your issue was  
09:39 <vmassol> ok  
09:40 <zwindler> I have no idea why this errors appear  
09:40 <zwindler> I have never seen those before  
09:40 <vmassol> ok, with the xwiki official image that you modified do you see these errors too?  
09:40 <vmassol> and can you paste me your hibernate.cfg.xml file that you said you modified?  
09:41 <vmassol> (on gist, pastebin, tc)  
09:41 <vmassol> (on gist, pastebin, etc)  
09:41 <zwindler> I just checked and it appears that I was thinking I modified something but the file seems similar  
09:41 <zwindler> false alarm  
09:41 <vmassol> ok because I cannot image what you'd have modified...  
09:41 <vmassol> ok so I'm sure you're also getting the same errors  
09:41 <zwindler> that seems probable  
09:42 <vmassol> I also tried with the jdbc driver version 42 and same errors  
09:42 <zwindler> just to be sure, on the official xwiki image  
09:42 <zwindler> you can go to distribution wizard  
09:42 <vmassol> yes  
09:42 <vmassol> and everything works too  
09:42 <vmassol> those are errors about the xwiki DB upgrade script that execute once at startup  
09:42 <zwindler> my bad really, I completly misunderstood you  
09:43 <zwindler> ok  
09:43 <vmassol> I'm starting to think that these errors exist even outside of the docker image, i.e. if you install xwiki with pgsql by hand. I need to verify this  
09:43 <vmassol> can you confirm you get those errors too?  
09:43 <vmassol> (just to be sure it's not related to the os for ex, but it shouldn't)  
09:43 <zwindler> yes  
09:43 <zwindler> I'll cehck  
09:43 <vmassol> thx  
09:43 <zwindler> I get back to you  
09:43 <vmassol> ok thx  
09:46 <vmassol> on another topiv guys  
09:46 <vmassol> \*topic  
09:46 <vmassol> I've added recently some new feedback comments on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DownloadFormFeedback  
09:47 <vmassol> in short the latest feedback:  
09:47 <vmassol> - Better and more complete user and admin documentation  
09:47 <vmassol> - more simple and easy maintenance  
09:47 <vmassol> - Beautiful page design will attract more people  
09:48 <zwindler> vmassol : same here  
09:49 <vmassol> zwindler: interesting since those feedback were quite terse and we need more details so we can ask you :)  
09:49 <vmassol> what is you main paint point in xwiki?.  
09:50 <zwindler> sorry  
09:50 <zwindler> I was interrupting  
09:51 <zwindler> Same error on the docker image on my side  
09:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <zwindler> Also, I confirm that the issue is also (at least partly) present on non docker installation  
09:52 <zwindler> our main xwiki is running with postgresql  
09:52 <zwindler> not docker  
09:52 <zwindler> and I get the hibernate\_sequence error in my logs  
09:53 <zwindler> For the line 62-65 I have to dig deeper  
09:58 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <vmassol> sorry back too :)  
10:01 <vmassol> ok good to know you're saving me a lot of time to try postgresql manually on xwiki!  
10:01 <vmassol> now I'll debug the issue. I've fixed this kind of errors several years ago for pgsql, jsut need to remember the topic  
10:11 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <flyingpot> has quit  
10:35 <Pbas> Hello, hope you are well. Today, I install a new xwiki behind a naughty proxy/FW (with white list). Could you tell me web site I must allow to go through my proxy to install/upgrade xwiki/extensions? I found these in xwiki.properties: http://nexus.xwiki.org, https://store.xwiki.com and http://extensions.xwiki.org (I didn't found them in xwiki documentation)  
10:36 <Pbas> I must add: http://java.sun.com and http://www.w3.org too?  
10:36 <Pbas> bc WEB-INF/web.xml file?  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> the first 3 you mentioned should be enough  
10:43 <Pbas> ok ty, then I will probably update your doc  
11:11 <floflobel> Hi, I need to export a page with history and author when I try in format "XAR" the history isn't save but the author so. I try to export all page of my wiki with the function included in administration page but the package is always corrupted.  
11:23 <vmassol> floflobel: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/Exports#HXARExport  
11:24 <vmassol> the admin export UI offers the option to export the history but not the UI at a single page level so you need to modify the url to add the history param  
11:24 <vmassol> (adding  &history=true)  
11:24 <vmassol> might be good to add a jira issue to suggest adding an UI option for that ;) (maybe it already exists?)  
11:30 <floflobel> vmassol: Thank's, I will watch on the tracker if issue exist  
11:38 <prakhar123> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <zwindler> has quit  
11:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm going to try upgrading xwiki.org to 8.4.4 this afternoon  
11:55 <vmassol> (and mflorea1  
11:55 <vmassol> )  
11:55 <vmassol> I need to know if I have to upgrade the server part of SOLR  
11:55 <vmassol> xwiki.org is currently on 8.2.1  
11:56 <vmassol> so I need to know if moving from 8.2.1 to 8.4.4 requires upgrading the SOLR server part  
11:56 <vmassol> could you help me in finding out this info? (btw do we put it in the RNs?)  
11:58 <tmortagne> vmassol: 8.4.4 embbed (and so expect) a more recent version of Solr so probably better upgrade it, I don't remember if the schema really changed but it's possible  
12:02 <tmortagne> so the XWiki Solr schema does not seems to have changed but better use the expected version of Solr in case some extension use something not supported by older version of Solr  
12:04 <vmassol> ok it's quite substantial more work which is why I was asking :)  
12:06 <vmassol> ok, I'll do it  
12:07 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you explain to me a bit more http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Migrations/#HUpgradeSOLRXWikisetup ?  
12:08 <vmassol> do I need to change anything in /usr/local/solr-xwiki/solr-home/xwiki/ (this is on the solr server side?)  
12:08 <vmassol> ?  
12:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: better follow http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Upgrading?srid=dd5iO92u#HUpgradeSolrserver  
12:11 <vmassol> ok thanks, I'll update the xwiki.org doc  
12:13 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <vmassol> guys I'm planning to do the followoing to put xwiki in readonly mode without restarting it  
12:15 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/71f98b4a10ca349aa91caadc81252262  
12:15 <vmassol> I'd like your validation that's it's safe  
12:15 <vmassol> I've tested it locally and it seems to work  
12:17 <flyingpot> has quit  
12:57 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
13:24 <dj\_xatra> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <dj\_xatra> Is it possible to add free markup to profile pages? Ideally, I'd like to do something like e.g. https://libreplanet.org/wiki/User:Aurelien  
13:28 <flyingpot> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <KermitTheFragger> hi all! Is there a way to prevent sessions from timeing out when people are in editors?  
13:33 <KermitTheFragger> (without setting the session timeout to some insane value)  
13:34 <KermitTheFragger> maybe some client side keep alive extension or something  
13:38 <vmassol> dj\_xatra: hi  
13:39 <vmassol> you have several options  
13:40 <vmassol> Option 1: edit your profile page and use the "Comments" field to add freeform content. That's the simplest  
13:42 <vmassol> Option 2: Add a DocumentSheetBinding xobject to your profile page and then edit in wiki mode the content and it'll be displayed. For example: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/VincentMassolTest  
14:02 <vmassol> tmortagne: I cannot find the info in the RN that we upgraded SOLR. Do you know where it is?  
14:02 <vmassol> I was also looking for the version of SOLR I need fro xwiki 8.4.4 from the RN  
14:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: I can see one on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Data/XWiki/8.4/#HUpgrades  
14:04 <vmassol> hard to find, had to look in the code: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/xwiki-platform-8.4.4/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-search/pom.xml#L35 --> 6.2.1  
14:04 <tmortagne> it's possible there was another upgrade before too  
14:04 <vmassol> hmm ok I missed it strange  
14:04 <tmortagne> not sure why you expect to find it in 8.4.4 RN  
14:05 <vmassol> I looked in all RN from 8.4.4 down to 8.2.1  
14:05 <vmassol> I search for "solr" in the pages  
14:05 <vmassol> somehow I missed this one... strange  
14:05 <prakhar123> has quit  
14:06 <tmortagne> the pom.xml is not exactly what I would call the code :)  
14:06 <vmassol> github is the code  
14:06 <vmassol> I wouldn 't expect people to have to do this  
14:06 <flyingpot> has quit  
14:06 <vmassol> if it's in the RN it's ok  
14:06 <tmortagne> what I did is order "upgrade to solr" matching jira issues  
14:06 <vmassol> but not very easy to find  
14:06 <vmassol> using jira is also complicated for users  
14:07 <vmassol> basically user admins need a simple way to know what version of SOLR they need when use an external solr  
14:07 <tmortagne> I'm not telling you users should look at jira, but most user don't care about the solr version  
14:07 <tmortagne> I'm not telling you users should look at jira, but most users don't care about the solr version  
14:07 <vmassol> yes most but not all :)  
14:07 <vmassol> I'm trying to improve ourselves  
14:07 <vmassol> upgrades are already difficult  
14:23 <vmassol> ok solr VM cloned and updated  
14:23 <vmassol> moving to releasing the xwiki.org flavor  
14:23 <vmassol> maybe someone can help me to know if I need to add new deps to the flavor...  
14:23 <vmassol> :)  
14:25 <dj\_xatra> Hm, my documentsheetbinding content displays way down on the page, below profile info, activity stream etc. :/  
14:28 <vmassol> need to find the versions of templates ui, ckeditor and tour for 8.4.4 now....  
14:28 <vmassol> (not tour)  
14:29 <vmassol> ok 1.10 for ckeditor  
14:30 <vmassol> and 1.0.1 for templates  
14:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't think you need the exact same version than the one that comes with XE, just a compatible one  
14:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't think you need the exact same version than the one that comes with XE, just a compatible one  
14:31 <vmassol> indeed  
14:31 <vmassol> but then I need someone to confirm that newer versions work in xwiki 8.4.4  
14:31 <vmassol> mflorea1: can you confirm for CK?  
14:31 <tmortagne> it's an extension that is supposed to support the LTS which is 8.4.4 currently  
14:32 <vmassol> ok using ck 1.12  
14:32 <vmassol> and 1.0.1 for templates  
14:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: I hope we haven't added any more deps....  
14:33 <tmortagne> you means more contrib extensions as dependencies to XE ?  
14:33 <vmassol> yes  
14:34 <vmassol> not XE  
14:34 <vmassol> <artifactId>xwiki-platform-distribution-flavor</artifactId>  
14:34 <tmortagne> I don't understand, xwiki-platform-distribution-flavor does not depend on any contrib extension  
14:34 <tmortagne> those come with XE  
14:35 <vmassol> tmortagne:  see https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/flavor-xwikiorg/blob/master/flavor-xwikiorg-subwiki/pom.xml  
14:35 <vmassol> we add stuff to the platform distribution  
14:35 <vmassol> (ie to the base flavor)  
14:35 <vmassol> we add == the xwiki.org flavor adds  
14:36 <tmortagne> yes I know that but what I said is that those are XE dependencies, not platform dependencies  
14:36 <vmassol> ok then we're talking about the same things probably  
14:36 <vmassol> we don't want the full XE deps though  
14:36 <vmassol> for ex we don't include tour  
14:37 <vmassol> (or blog)  
14:37 <vmassol> ok taking the risk, going to release now  
14:38 <tmortagne> IMO this xwiki.org flavor is too painful to maintain, it would really be much simpler to just use XE and make sure it can be configuredfor our need (make the search go to main wiki instead of current wiki, etc)  
14:38 <vmassol> yes for sure  
14:38 <tmortagne> IMO this xwiki.org flavor is too painful to maintain, it would really be much simpler to just use XE and make sure it can be configuredfor our needs (make the search go to main wiki instead of current wiki, etc)  
14:38 <vmassol> without blog, etc  
14:39 <tmortagne> we already decide to move blog as contrib extension AFAIK  
14:39 <vmassol> hmm xwikipreferences is hard, let's hope it hasn't changed  
14:39 <vmassol> yes but it'll be in the KB flavor  
14:39 <vmassol> same as tour
